intro: Coelospermum scandens, commonly known as the climbing coelospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Coelospermum scandens is often found growing along riverbanks and in moist, shaded areas, where it climbs using its tendrils to reach sunlight.
